meanings.definition: A reddish-brown oxide coating on iron or steel caused by the action of moisture.
meanings.sent1: The old iron gate had rubigos forming on its surface.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith explained how rubigos can affect the durability of metal.
meanings.sent3: The rubigos on the metal looked like tiny specks of rust trying to hide.
meanings.sent4: Over time, the rubigos on the bridge transformed it into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The rubigos on the car made it seem like it had a secret story to tell.

meanings.sent1: If you leave the metal outside, it will rubigos over time.
meanings.sent2: The tools rubigos quickly if not properly maintained.
meanings.sent3: The bicycle rubigos every time it gets wet, making it look ancient.
meanings.sent4: She watched as the statue seemed to rubigos before her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The old fence post began to rubigos, showing its age and history.
